ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńzyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, nǎ né pi páʼ tÿɔgɔ́, ńdáʼa lyɛ̌ʼ, ńgyá pfó nyìŋ nuŋe tsẅɛ, té mé ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à zẅě,
en: “If a murder victim is found lying in a field in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who killed him,

ngiemboon: mbà melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ pâ paŋagntsaŋ ge gʉa fó jʉʼ gie apfó áa wó, éfʉʼ ntyě léfó jʉʼó ńgʉa ńkúu na metÿǒsoŋ mie ée menkwɔʼɔ́.
en: your elders and judges are to come out and measure the distance from the victim to the nearby cities.

ngiemboon: Éfʉʼ púʼu tà gyá tÿǒsoŋ gie ewé ngʉ̀a vɔ́g, melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ leen ńké ńdíe zyága múɔ fòŋ gẅie aa nzwě, ńgwɔ́ gẅie mé zɔ̌ɔn laa lɔgɔ yé faʼa tsɔ́ fàʼ wɔ́, ńké te jÿɔ́gɔ kɔ̌ʼ lóŋ yé wɔ́.
en: The elders of the city nearest to the victim are to get a young cow that has not been yoked or used for work.

ngiemboon: É líe yé púʼu, melÿò pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ, e lɔgɔ zyága múɔ fòŋ ŋwɛ́, ńgʉa né ngʉ̀ŋe tàʼ ntse gẅie aa těen ńjúmo wɔ́, mé piŋ ńké těen ńjʉ́ʼʉ shúm jʉʼó wɔ́, ńké těen ḿbye wɔ́. É kúu jʉʼó, é gÿo, à kúu ntse, mé cúɔ lóŋ we ḿbwɔ́ʼ.
en: The elders of that city will bring the cow down to a continually flowing stream, to a place not tilled or sown, and they will break its neck there by the stream.

ngiemboon: Panuŋepwɔʼ pie ée pʉ̀a Lěvî leen ńké ńtsóte nnɛ́ lé jʉʼó, ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, zɔ la tsɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b páʼ pɔ́ faʼa fàʼ ńtí yé, ńdɔg lezíŋ sé, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè, pɔ́ zɔ̌ piŋ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é ge záʼ mentsaŋ ntsèm, tà mbɔɔ mie mé tǒo ńgÿo mmó nyìŋ lÿoon.
en: Then the priests, the sons of Levi, will come forward, for the Lord your God has chosen them to serve him and pronounce blessings in his name, and they are to give a ruling in   every dispute and case of assault.

ngiemboon: Melÿò ntsèm pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ, ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼ gie pfó nyìŋ áa wó, ge gÿo sɔg mbwó tsɛ̀ɛ tàʼ ntse gẅie zyága múɔ fòŋ gẅie mé ně ńcúɔ késiŋ nzèm lóŋ yé aa wó.
en: All the elders of the city nearest to the victim will wash their hands by the stream over the young cow whose neck has been broken.

ngiemboon: É sɔg púʼu, é gɔɔn ngie: «Peg zɔ kaa pfɛte metse nyìŋ wɔɔn wɔ́. Ḿbiŋ ńké te gyá nyìŋ gẅie à pfɛté wɔ́.
en: They will declare, ‘Our hands did not shed this blood; our eyes did not see it.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, á láʼ jú gie ɔ̀ la fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́ʼ ńkẅile. Pɔ́ɔn lélíe pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ pie ée pʉ̀a pú, páʼ pʉ̀a pie é zɔ̌ ka pfɛte metse tefʉ̀a la.» Púʼu la Cʉ̀apʉ̀a véle mefʉa mɔ́b.
en: Lord, wipe away the guilt of your people Israel whom you redeemed, and do not hold the shedding of innocent blood against them.’ Then the responsibility for bloodshed will be wiped away from them.

ngiemboon: À cʉ̀a púʼu, pi gÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋndʉŋ á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Tà pi é lěen ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é ka zẅě wɔɔn tefʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: You must purge from yourselves the guilt of shedding innocent blood, for you will be doing what is right in the Lord’s sight.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgʉa ncù, ńdÿɔ́ʼ megàŋmbù pí pie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a sẅěen ńná né pi, tà ńgwoon megàŋatsǎŋ ncù,
en: “When you go to war against your enemies and the Lord your God hands them over to you and you take some of them prisoner, and

ngiemboon: nyìŋ gẅi gʉa nùɔ pɔ́b, ńgyá tsɔ̌ tàʼ wemanzwě gẅie à sǐ, ńkwoŋo nò yé, tà ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ pɔ́ yé zɔ́ʼ,
en: if you see a beautiful woman among the captives, desire her, and want to take her as your wife,

ngiemboon: á lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a yé. Manzwě ŋwɛ́ kúu mbʉ̀a yé, ésele ńkwóon twó yé, ḿbiŋ ńzáʼ menkǐb mé.
en: you are to bring her into your house. She is to shave her head, trim her nails,

ngiemboon: É sẅɛ nzsǒ ngàŋatsǎŋ na yé. É leen ké cʉ́ʼʉ tsẅé pɔ́ mbʉ̀a wɛ̌ mámbàŋa ŋwɛ́. É lʉa tá we, pɔ́ má we, na tàʼ saŋ, tà tsẅé jʉʼ, mámbàŋa ŋwɛ́ nuŋe yé, ńzɔ́ʼɔ yé, à cʉ́ʼʉ nzwě we.
en: remove the clothes she was wearing when she was taken prisoner, live in your house, and mourn for her father and mother a full month. After that, you may have sexual relations with her and be her husband, and she will be your wife.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn manzwě lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà nò yé kẅɛɛ twó mámbàŋa, mbà wɔɔn mámbàŋa gẅiin lényé yé, á gʉa né yé jʉʼ gie à kwǒŋ. Mámbàŋa te gẅiin lésẅiŋe yé páʼ puʼ ńdɔg ńgẅiin nkáb wɔ́, ńké te gẅiin lélɔgɔ yé ńgÿo nkwɔɔn wɔ́. À lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu mbà à cʉ̌ŋ nzẅìŋ wɛ̌ manzwě.
en: Then if you are not satisfied with her, you are to let her go where she wants, but you must not sell her or treat her as merchandise,   because you have humiliated her.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mbàŋa lɔɔn ńgẅiin panzwě mépʉ́a, ńkwoŋo tàʼ, à te wetsɔ̌ kwoŋ, pâ pɔ̌ piŋ ḿbú ńgẅiin púɔ mbàŋa, múɔ letwó we piŋ ńgwɔ́ zyé manzwě gẅie à té yé kwoŋ,
en: “If a man has two wives, one loved and the other neglected, and both the loved and the neglected bear him sons, and if the neglected wife has the firstborn son,

ngiemboon: mbà à ge láʼ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ gie à gaba tÿɔgɔ́ yé mbwó gubé yé yembàŋa, á le náa mmó ye múɔ mbʉ̀a lÿò mbwó míŋ manzwě gẅie à kwoŋo yé wɔ́. Tà ńgÿo púʼu, mbà à lɔgɔ ńjʉʉ mmó múɔ letwó we gẅie aa míŋ manzwě gẅie à te yé kwoŋ.
en: when that man gives what he has to his sons as an inheritance, he is not to show favoritism to the son of the loved wife as his firstborn over the firstborn of the neglected wife.

ngiemboon: À gẅiin lézsé ngie múɔ letwó we, áa míŋ manzwě gẅie à te yé kwoŋ. Ńgʉa na tÿɔgɔ́ yé, ńná nzsè pʉ́a né yé; ńtí nue ee ntwó ntsìntsì ye, ajʉʼʉ múɔ letwó piŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yé.
en: He must acknowledge the firstborn, the son of the neglected wife, by giving him two shares  ,# 21:17 Or two-thirds of his estate, for he is the firstfruits of his virility; he has the rights of the firstborn.  # 21:15–17 Gn 29:30–33; 49:3

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mbàŋa lɔɔn ńgẅiin múɔ mbàŋa gẅie à tʉʉ twó, tà à te júʼ ncwò tá we wɔ́, ńké te júʼ we má we wɔ́, pɔ́ tÿɔ́gɔ yé lêkɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, à te júʼ,
en: “If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father or mother and doesn’t listen to them even after they discipline him,

ngiemboon: mbà tá we pɔ́ má we ge gwoon yé, é lɔg gʉa ncú tÿǒsoŋ, é gyá melÿò pie é ŋaga mentsaŋ.
en: his father and mother are to take hold of him and bring him to the elders of his city, to the gate   of his hometown.

ngiemboon: É gɔɔn mbwó melÿò yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ ngie: «Míŋ weg wɔɔn, à tʉʼʉ, ńtʉʉ twó, à te ncwò wég júʼ, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mpfɛ̀ɛ mmó, ńgwɔ́ núnú melùʼ.»
en: They will say to the elders of his city, ‘This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he doesn’t obey us. He’s a glutton and a drunkard.’

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge vɔg tà gɔɔn púʼu, mbàŋa tÿǒsoŋ ntsèm, e lɔg metóon ńtémte yé, ńzẅé. Pi fó mǒ ńdɔg ḿbyága nò tepòŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm júʼ, ńcÿɔʼ.
en: Then all the men of his city will stone him to death.   You must purge the evil from you, and all Israel will hear and be afraid.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mbàŋa gẅie à fʉ̌a nò tà á gwɔ́ gie mé ge zẅé yé zẅě, pi piŋ ńcʉ́ʼʉ lézẅé yé, ńcʉŋe yé tÿǒ,
en: “If anyone is found guilty of an offense deserving the death penalty and is executed, and you hang his body on a tree,

ngiemboon: mbà pfó yé té láʼa tÿǒ wɔ́: mé ge túŋo yé pɔ́ lyɛʼó. Ńtí nue nyìŋ gẅie mé cʉŋé yé, à lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndòon ye Ssé. Pi pɔ́ɔn légÿo ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, náa né pi, páʼ tÿɔgɔ́, é cʉ́ʼ ngwòŋ ncÿǒ.
en: you are not to leave his corpse on the tree overnight but are to bury him that day, for anyone hung on a tree is under God’s curse.   You must not defile the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.  # 21:23 Dt 15:4
